intro: Hypertelis spergulacea, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, typically blooming in the spring. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. The species is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
